meanings.definition: A portion or part of a whole, especially a whole number that divides another number evenly.
meanings.sent1: She poured an aliquot of juice into each glass.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for an aliquot of sugar.
meanings.sent3: The aliens requested an aliquot of water to fuel their spaceship.
meanings.sent4: His kindness was an aliquot of light in her dark days.
meanings.sent5: The teacher divided the candies into aliquots for the students to share equally.

meanings.definition: To divide into equal parts or portions.
meanings.sent1: He aliquoted the cake into slices for everyone.
meanings.sent2: The chef aliquoted the ingredients for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: She aliquoted her time between work and hobbies.
meanings.sent4: The leader aliquoted the tasks among the team members.
meanings.sent5: The farmer aliquoted the field into sections for planting different crops.
